answers.answer: Hi,Your father may be suffering from balance disorder. Balance disorder may be caused by infections (viral or bacterial), head injury, blood circulation disorders affecting the inner ear or brain, certain medications, aging, brain disorders, injuries of the visual or skeletal systems, eg. eye muscle imbalance and arthritis. Please consult a physician, ENT specialist and neurologist for examination, diagnosis and treatment. Hope this helps you. Take care and regards!

question: My dad is 62 years old and he is having problems walking in the last month.  He has diabetes, high blood pressure, and has had 1 heart attack in the last year.  He feels like the floor is falling out under him when he is walking and has to grab on to something.  It is getting worse and I am worried.  What could this be?Thanks,Sandy
title: Help with my Dad!!
